jparsec.ephem.event

Class MainEvents

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.event.MainEvents

  • public class MainEvents
extends java.lang.Object
    Main events for the year.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MainEvents.EVENT_TIME
      The set of event 'times', to select the previous, next, or closest event to a given input time.

    • Method Detail

      • MoonPhaseOrEclipse

        public static SimpleEventElement MoonPhaseOrEclipse(double jd,
                                    SimpleEventElement.EVENT event,
                                    MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                             throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of a given Moon phase or eclipse, following Meeus's Astronomical Algorithms. Error is always below 2 minutes, and usually below 1 minute.
        Parameters:
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations in dynamical time.
        event - The event, constants defined in SimpleEventElement (MOON_...).
        eventType - The event type (next, last, or closest to input date). The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • EquinoxesAndSolstices

        public static SimpleEventElement EquinoxesAndSolstices(int year,
                                       SimpleEventElement.EVENT event)
                                                throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of an equinox or solstice, with a precission of 1s.
        Parameters:
        year - The year.
        event - The event, constants defined in SimpleEventElement (SUN_...).
        Returns:
        The event.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • meteorShowers

        public static SimpleEventElement[] meteorShowers(int year)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instants of the maximum of meteor showers.
        Parameters:
        year - The year.
        Returns:
        The events. The name of the event will be set as Spanish name|English name|radiant position|THZ|Julian day of maximum in TDB|JD in TDB of first date when the shower is visible|JD in TDB of the last date when it is visible.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • SaturnRingsEdgeOn

        public static SimpleEventElement SaturnRingsEdgeOn(double jd,
                                   MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                            throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the time when the rings of Saturn will be visible edge-on (more exactly, when the position angle of pole will be 0 from Earth's geocenter). Calculations are done using Moshier method with an accuracy of 1 minute for the output time.
        Parameters:
        jd - Starting calculation time.
        eventType - Event type.
        Returns:
        The event.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • SaturnRingsMaximumAperture

        public static SimpleEventElement SaturnRingsMaximumAperture(double jd,
                                            MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                                     throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the time when the rings of Saturn will be visible with maximum aperture (more exactly, when the position angle of pole will be maximum or minimum from Earth's geocenter). Calculations are done using Moshier method with an accuracy of 1 minute for the output time.
        Parameters:
        jd - Starting calculation time.
        eventType - Event type.
        Returns:
        The event. The details field will contain the position angle of pole in degrees.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • PerihelionAndAphelion

        public static SimpleEventElement PerihelionAndAphelion(Target.TARGET target,
                                       double jd,
                                       SimpleEventElement.EVENT event,
                                       MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                                throws JPARSECException
        Deprecated. MainEvents#getPlanetaryEvent(TARGET, double, EVENT, EVENT_TIME) is recommended instead.
        Calculates the approximate instant of the closest perihelion or aphelion in time following Meeus. In current dates the difference compared to MainEvents#getPlanetaryEvent(Target#TARGET, double, SimpleEventElement#EVENT, MainEvents#EVENT_TIME) is of a few hours for inner planets and more than one day for giant planets, and the other method is more accurate than this one.
        Parameters:
        target - Target body. Earth is allowed.
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations.
        event - The event, constants defined in SimpleEventElement (PLANET_...).
        eventType - The event type (next, last, or closest to input date). The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event. The target body ID value is given in the details field.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • Conjunction

        public static SimpleEventElement Conjunction(Target.TARGET target,
                             double jd,
                             MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Deprecated. MainEvents#getPlanetaryEvent(TARGET, double, EVENT, EVENT_TIME) will give better results, although this method is indeed used in the other to obtain a fast first estimate.
        Calculates the instant of a given planetary conjunction, following Meeus's Astronomical Algorithms. Error is around a few hours.
        Parameters:
        target - The target ID constant. Valid objects are any planet (Mercury to Neptune, except Earth).
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations.
        eventType - The event type (next, last, or closest to input date). The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event. In case the target is Mercury or Venus the details field will be 'Superior' for superior conjunction of 'Inferior' for an inferior one.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • OppositionOrMaxElongation

        public static SimpleEventElement OppositionOrMaxElongation(Target.TARGET target,
                                           double jd,
                                           MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                                    throws JPARSECException
        Deprecated. MainEvents#getPlanetaryEvent(TARGET, double, EVENT, EVENT_TIME) will give better results, although this method is indeed used in the other to obtain a fast first estimate.
        Calculates the instant of a given planetary opposition or maximum elongation (Mercury and Venus), following Meeus's Astronomical Algorithms. Error is around a few hours.
        Parameters:
        target - The target ID constant. Valid objects are any planet (Mercury to Neptune, except Earth).
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations.
        eventType - The event type (next, last, or closest to input date). The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event. In case the target is Mercury or Venus the details field will contains the elongation in degrees and the E for maximum elongation towards East, or 'W' for maximum elongation towards west from the Sun.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPlanetaryEvent

        public static SimpleEventElement getPlanetaryEvent(Target.TARGET target,
                                   double jd,
                                   SimpleEventElement.EVENT event,
                                   MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType,
                                   boolean maximumAccuracy)
                                            throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of a given planetary event. Precision is of a few minutes for inner planets.
        Parameters:
        target - The target ID constant. Valid objects are the planets, Pluto, and the Moon.
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations.
        event - The event, constants defined in SimpleEventElement (PLANET_...).
        eventType - The event type (next, last, or closest to input date). The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        maximumAccuracy - True for maximum accuracy (few minutes of error at most), false for approximate but faster result.
        Returns:
        The event data. The maximum/minimum distance or elongation (in AU and degrees) will be given as a number in the details of the event.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMercuryOrVenusTransit

        public static SimpleEventElement getMercuryOrVenusTransit(Target.TARGET target,
                                          double jd,
                                          double jd_limit,
                                          boolean maximumAccuracy)
                                                   throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of a given Mercury or Venus transit. Precision in the time of the maximum is of a few minutes.
        Parameters:
        target - The target ID constant. Valid objects are Mercury and Venus.
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations.
        jd_limit - Limiting Julian day. If it is crossed a null object will be returned.
        maximumAccuracy - True for maximum accuracy (few minutes of error at most), false for approximate but faster result.
        Returns:
        The event, or null if it is not found. The minimum elongation (degrees) will be given as a number in the details of the event.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getJupiterGRSLongitude

        public static double getJupiterGRSLongitude(double JD_TDB)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns the longitude of the Great Red Spot (GRS), using historical observations. Data available only since 1969. For previous dates and dates after last update a linear extrapolation is used. Data is regularly updated from Sky & Telescope and ALPO.
        Parameters:
        JD_TDB - Julian day.
        Returns:
        GRS longitude (system II), in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getJupiterGRSNextTransitTime

        public static SimpleEventElement getJupiterGRSNextTransitTime(double JD_TDB)
                                                       throws JPARSECException
        Returns the instant of the next transit of the Great Red Spot. Calculations are performed by default for the geocenter, using Moshier algorithms and IAU 2006 resolutions. IAU 2009 is not used here since it introduces differences of several degrees in the longitude of the central meridian.
        Parameters:
        JD_TDB - Input dynamical time as a Julian day.
        Returns:
        Output dynamical time of the next transit, with a theoretical precision better than one second (obviously unrealistic).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
